title: Fear of Tank Metas vs What We Have Now
body:
So... which is it? Everyone complains that dying in 0.28 seconds is terrible, but then you talk about buffing the only two classes designed to STOP damage dealers from simply having their way... and everyone QQs about that, too. There is one simple truth, and only one:

Either

A: Tanks (and enchanters) are strong enough to do their jobs, and be monsters that keep the damage dealers apart via various devices - hoping for better initiation and team positioning.

Or

B: They are not strong enough to do their jobs, and damage dealers roam around doing what every they want.

Both cannot be true at the same time.
-------------------------
You complained about the Tank Metas and Enchanter Metas. (Which were itemization metas. Nothing to do with the actual classes.) They nerfed the items, but they still felt TOO HARD to deal with!!!!! So they nerfed the classes as well.  But you people STILL needed ways to "deal with tanks" because they were "really hard to kill, QQ!!" You got Conqueror. Finally people complained they were useless, and needed to do more damage to feel viable, and you learned exactly how hard Tanks and Juggernauts were designed to scale if they ever built damage. I.E. Galio, Malphite, Alistair, J4 and others.

Now EVERYBODY does too much damage which illicits many a QQ, and any talk of bringing the old classes back to standing to start doing their jobs again also gets much QQing. 

Pick one, or shut up. You can't just want your pet role to feel better, without having a challenge from the other roles. That's what a MOBA is all about. Every champion should be challenging to deal with in it's own right.

replies.body:
Indeed... and {{item:3153}} was one of the ways I was talking about that players "needed to deal with tanks" instead of RIOT actually fixing the tank items they had broken at the time. Which fed into every ADC grabbing one since it's effective against everybody. Then they "fixed" {{item:3075}} to try to counterbalance it... and broke more.

My theory is that their item group is utter shit.
Conquerer is the result of RIOT forgetting bruisers existed when they designed the new rune system.

I prefer Defensive metas over Offensive metas but that's just me. I play burst Mages but even with Tanks I can still burst out the other Mage, ADC, or White Mage (Enchanter), while having CC to peel for myself and ADC/Support.  I just feel their is more strategy with tanks and marksman around.

Absolutely. I liked tank meta for the same reason. Yeah it was unnecessary hard to win a fight and than take 2 more minutes just to kill the tank. But everybody would do their job and had their Rock-Paper-Scissor opponents. Mages burstes Squishys, Tanks CCed them and peeled for Squishiys to prevent, that burst, Brusiers peeled the tanks away from the squishys so the burst could work and ADC tried to kill the tanks and bruisersm while the assassins tried the same with the ADCs and Mages. We had a healty circle. Now we have everything just running at squishys and than fighting it out later. 

In tank meta everybody had to do their job and kill the tank. Now everybody just has to kill. It is really anyoing when the freaking whole enemy frontline just runs at the backline while yours tries the same. The squishys just die and than the tanks/brusiers and highly mobile chars fight it out after the imobiles have been just deleted. 

Maybe I am exagerating, there are surely positive aspects to the burst meta aswell, you can argue, "who bursts firsts can protect the squishys after and thus wins" but for me as a squishy player I have lost my agency I can be fed all I want, when a Vi decides to go at me nothing can stop her, because she needs ult and  W E to kill me. Nothing else. 

I'd like to see a state where carries would still die to something like that, but have it take long enough that your team at least could try to react. As it is right now, everything below 3k HP just explodes. 

I have won games, where I just AFK farmed. The enemy brusier and assassin waited all fight long for me to join the fight, never blow their spells just to burst me, and since I never arrived they never dealt dmg and my team won. It literally went like that. First my team flamed me, than they realized after I mentioned it, that we won every fight I did not join :D

It's weird, because this meta feels like S3, it's just not as fun as you'd think it would be. Sure I can blow up anyone, but anyone can blow me up too. It literally comes down to who bursts 1st, and after you blow your load you get someone elses load in your face.

The thing is though, no one will ever be happy until the meta fits them the best, I'd rather we all be in the same state, oh fuck tanks are tanky, better protect the AD so he can shred him. Meanwhile when the chances arrives I'mma blow their AD up.

Tanks absorb Magic damage, AD's slowly shred tanks, Mages blow ADs up. It's the circle of life. Bruisers and Assassins can still get in on the mix, but to me, the best metas are Tank/Fighter - Fighter/Tank - Mage/Assassin - Marksman - Enchanter/Tank. People will say the best Marksman will win but that simply isn't true, it's the best team that wins..
Delete runes to solve everything
It will... never... happen. Doesn't matter how much people complain, it's RIOT's pet project.
By the gamers, for the gamers.

Yeahhhhhh... what they mean by that now days, since Icefrog, Morello, Guinsoo, Pendragon, and all the rest were forced out by Tencent, is this:

"We sometimes play our own game, therefore we are gamers, and the gamers we do this for are us."
Gamers rise up.

There's a middle ground to everything.

But what we want exactly is to nerf tanks damage wise. They'll still be very annoying to face in teamfights due to their CC, but they won't shit on you in lane.

And to (obviously) gut every form of sustained dps true damage

That won’t work. A class that’s meant to lose lane and never be able to 1v1 just can’t really work. 

Sure you’d be useful in 5v5s... but how would you get to teamfights? You’ll never have lane prio since you will never win trades so you can’t really walk up to the wave and contest it at most points in the game... you just have to wait under tower to collect the CS. Until eventually bruisers just start ignoring your no damage ass and hit the tower instead, while you desperately try and clear the wave. Unless you give them high range uninteractive waveclear where they don’t even have to look at the enemy champion in fear of hard losing the trade.

So the only way to join a 5v5 is to give up multiple waves and probably towers. 

The “no damage tank” is a myth. The only tanks (top lane) that have ever been good have done comparable damage to other top laners in the early-mid game. Except at the time damage was overall lower so tanks didn’t burst you but neither did most bruisers. 

“Low damage tanks” might only be viable in jungle and support, and even jungle is questionable looking at the iterations of Zac and Sejuani. ~~~~
Low damage is fine, so long as the tank has the sustain to win trades (and sometimes all-ins).

Imo, every team should have the holy trinity or at least a healthy amount of utility and damage combined to make up for interesting games.

In the current meta if you draft a team full of assasins and damage dealers, it's a valid team comp, but in the older days you needed the tank / utility / support pick
As someone who plays a burst mage i really hate the tank meta however this assassin meta we have now is far worse. every game is 2-3 Assassin with the game being over by the 10m mark.

Right? At least you can kite, or wear them down, and let the fighters and ADCs take them down. 

Better than disappearing instantly to something so mobile you might get a spell off at.

why don't you just make damage kits not so 1 dimensional in their function and actually offer defensive bonuses themselves like other MOBAs already figured out years ago 

and then we can phase out these shitty enchanter/tank designs entirely for a proper skill game

> and then we can phase out these shitty enchanter/tank designs entirely for a proper skill game

you bitching about 1 dimensional playstyles while crying for volibear buffs
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

not that I disagree with you that enchanters and tanks have pretty bland playstyles but they do have to worry about other things, peeling for ADC and engaging a teamfight at the right moment forexample
volibear isn't 1 dimensional just because you aren't megabrained enough to know how to flex with him lol. A galactic mind like myself does not know that struggle.
Voli is one dimensional and he will get a Gameplay rework eventually for that exactly reason.

> rework** eventually**


that's been 2 champs released and one rework binned in this preseason, they need to switch things around and have 2/3 reworks per new champion for atleast a year


{{champion:34}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:26}} {{champion:131}} to name a few that really need work done

Indeed. I want a Zillean jungle rework.

https://thumbs.gfycat.com/ShadyLimpIberianlynx-size_restricted.gif
I miss CrazyBoris :(

offtopic

any reason why I am seeing more volibear "ADC" paired with a blitz/Leona/naut rather than jungle/top bear?
Not to my knowledge. JG/Top is standard, sees play in high elo as a support very rarely. He's OK as an ADC and would honestly be decent there if his items werent trash

>not that I disagree with you that enchanters and tanks have pretty bland playstyles but they do have to worry about other things, peeling for ADC and engaging a teamfight at the right moment forexample

"they have to do their job, they're so hard lol" 

voli has to not get slowed as soon as he Qs with no hard mobility to guarantee he closes the gap and a literal split-second on his E to stop faster dashes; it's only a guarantee vs obvious tells like kalista and trist, but jax/irelia/pretty much any assassin is different. voli has way more thought necessary than any enchanter and most tanks bar maybe ornn

i like how you intentionally misinterpret my post, too, very good work

what other mobas have rid themselves of enchanter/tanks?

dw I will wait

>he's still intentionally misinterpreting the post that clearly says:

>why don't you just make **DAMAGE** kits not so 1 dimensional in their function and actually offer defensive bonuses themselves like other MOBAs already figured out years ago 

other mobas never came into the discussion you're trying to stick me with

> why don't you just make damage kits not so 1 dimensional in their function and actually offer defensive bonuses themselves like **other MOBAs already figured out years ago **
> and then we can phase out these shitty enchanter/tank designs entirely for a proper skill game

excuse me

>Pick one, or shut up. You can't just want your pet role to feel better, without having a challenge from the other roles. That's what a MOBA is all about. Every champion should be challenging to deal with in it's own right.

Well, see, this would work if League of Legends was played by exactly one person. But it's not. League of Legends is home to a bajillion different all people who have drastically different versions of the "proper" way League should be played. 

* You have Johnny Casual, who thinks Riot should cater to everyone Sub-gold and only balance around them. Assassins should also not exist.
* You have TSM Kelly, who is a pro player that thinks the game should only be balanced around DIamond 1+. Assassins need buffs btw.
* You have Yosef ARAM, who only plays aram. That's his gimmick. Like that's all he does. Assassins are trash on ARAM lul.
* You have Lena Lore, who plays for the story and doesn't give two shits about the game. Assassins have deep lore.

Each one has their own ideal meta and each one will come to the boards to voice their discontent when things are bad in their PoV. The only people who are always on are usually the hyper dedicated who love league regardless of its state or those that quit years ago and take every new complaint as a fresh sign that the game is finally dying for the 8th time in its lifespan. (But THIS time it's real).

You forgot the person who only watches pro play and doesn't care about actually playing, who thinks the game should be balanced about being fun to watch (buff assasins, they can make flashy outplays).

This is true. Though I must admit I've never understood the people who have quit playing, but STILL come to the boards. The times I've spent 6mo or a year away, I also didn't come to the boards. Didn't make sense to bother myself with something that I wasn't even paying attention to.

That said, I WAS mostly talking to the average board member, more than the occasional pokers.

> [{quoted}](name=Cats Are Food,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gAuyGgV6,comment-id=00170002,timestamp=2019-01-16T02:36:07.906+0000)
>
> This is true. Though I must admit I've never understood the people who have quit playing, but STILL come to the boards. The times I've spent 6mo or a year away, I also didn't come to the boards. Didn't make sense to bother myself with something that I wasn't even paying attention to.

A lot of people who leave never have a clean "Game's just not for me anymore. Thanks for the enjoyment Riot, good luck!".  Generally, when someone leaves (in my experience) they often want to prove how right their decision was and frequent the zones where complaining is highest to get a sense that they were right. Same reason why you always see someone in a complaint post going "Lol I quit <x> ago just goes to show how right I was". 

It's like sunken cost fallacy where you invested so much into quitting you have to keep checking back that you were right in the end.

Games go through peaks and valleys and I'm sure with every other game that is experiencing a slight downturn in business there are folks who think its dead.

While league I believe is far from it, there is a lot on riot's plate right now. Other fresher genres entering into the fold, their whole 2018 expose' situation, downsizing in e-sports, implementing a huge number of changes. I believe all of these things have cut pretty deep into their numbers but with any game all it takes is a decent attractive change (like MMO's with their expansions) to get themselves back to fairly strong numbers. With a MOBA I'm not sure how you do that though.

> [{quoted}](name=CodyIicious,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gAuyGgV6,comment-id=00170001,timestamp=2019-01-15T16:53:46.688+0000)
>
> Games go through peaks and valleys and I'm sure with every other game that is experiencing a slight downturn in business there are folks who think its dead.
> 
> While league I believe is far from it, there is a lot on riot's plate right now. Other fresher genres entering into the fold, their whole 2018 expose' situation, downsizing in e-sports, implementing a huge number of changes. I believe all of these things have cut pretty deep into their numbers but with any game all it takes is a decent attractive change (like MMO's with their expansions) to get themselves back to fairly strong numbers. With a MOBA I'm not sure how you do that though.

Gonna be real: MOBAs are just on the way out. 

While they'll always have more consistent numbers and easier ways of getting people back (MMOs have to drop a whole patch/expac. MOBAs just gotta release a new character), people aren't as invested in them anymore. In addition, from the way gaming has gone as a trend, MOBAs are just too longer.

MMOs (which kicked off in 2000 all the way to 2009 or so) were popular despite a massive grind to hit the max level and end-game content. Then come along MOBAs which sandwich the entire leveling experience in games that usually last up to an hour. Now you have Battle Royale games which can last anywhere from 20 minutes to 12 seconds. At which point you just requeue into a new game. You see this also with how MOBAs design things now: There's an emphasis on faster games in every version. DOTA was actually the first to do it in 2015 with Turbo Mode because they saw the writing on the wall before anyone else. 

Thankfully MOBAs also have a thriving esport scene which few games can have but as for game-games, they're just not the "in" genre anymore.

Let's just bring the game back to late S5, after the {{item:1401}}  nerfs and before the Juggernaut reworks; tanks tanking, carries carrying, assassins assassinating, mages having actual build choices: in short, everyone doing what they are supposed to do, period.

You mistake the problem of a Tank meta: 

The problem with a Tank Meta, is not that Tanks are able to do their original jobs. It's that they are now able to effectively kill any carry along with being the premier damage soaker on a team. It wasn't uncommon to see Tanks fill both the top, jungle and support roles in the game, and be able to kill any Carry they got close too, even fighters had problems with these guys. 

Tank Meta isn't just less damage. The damage is moving towards Tanks being able to kill practically anyone but the most dedicated tank killers.
If I (the tank) can stick to you for 10+ seconds I deserve to kill you (the squishy carry). If you can't kill me then that's not a problem of me having too much damage.
Can I have some tips on how you last 0.28? my best so far is 0.17

Even in tank meta...people still played squishy/assasin plays because they simply enjoy them more.
What is Tank meta? Riot will return tank meta by giving Tanks more DMG,so they will have higher burst and damage then actually assasins.
What we need to do is to buff DEFFENSE on tanks,not buffing their dmg (sejuani,galio,ornn) just to name a few.Buff theri RESISTANCE.
Let them do what they should.
Remove Zyra,Brand,Veigar,Pyke from bot lane.Since when midlaners became supports that are dealing higher dmg then ADCs while they have zero items?
nerf the damage,and stop buffing tanks by giving them more damage.
Just SIMPLY NERF the overall damage of BURST mages and Assasins.
Don't forget the conqueror lmao.

Except the viability of tanks and enchanters isnt the sole reason for a 'damage meta'. A huge contributing factor is the new Runes system which straight up increased burst damage. Another factor is buffs to itemization that further increases upfront burst damage like {{item:3285}} {{item:3147}}

...Which said damage overall not only lowered the value of both classes, but also weakened said classes.
Look at the %pen items and tell me how they don't counter the very concept of tanking entirely almost by itself (% armor pen got changed during midseason).
Sure, early game they might be able to survive you with their pseudo stats (Aftershock users, hint hint), but once midgame rolls around, they kinda lose any value in what they do.

in season 5 it was tanks and bruisers while enchanters were situational. infact youd sometimes get questioned "why janna?" bruiser itemization wasnt overloaded either and they either had to build some defence items or go full DPS.

Im consistent 

Fuck tanks 

The whole class is counter fun

Their purpose is to prevent you from be able to input commands
Fuck assassins their only goal is to nuke you with immunity to counter play.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gAuyGgV6,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2019-01-15T01:37:44.574+0000)
>
> Fuck assassins their only goal is to nuke you with immunity to counter play.

Which assassin lacks counterplay?

Its not about lacking counterplay. Its that all they want is immunity to counter play. 

All rengar mains want to do is Press R Jump at someone and have the enemy die. Run away do it again. 

All Zed Mains want to do is press R, Hit one auto jump away and have you die. 

Tanks and enchanters bring real counterplay to the game. Not just this "Kill me faster or lose counterplay" Lulu used to be able to stop rengars from nuking targets just with R+shield. Good luck stopping him before he kills your adc in .25 seconds now.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gAuyGgV6,comment-id=000c000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-15T01:56:02.995+0000)

> Its not about lacking counterplay. Its that all they want is immunity to counter play.

>

Rengar...is...shit design period
 
> All Zed Mains want to do is press R, Hit one auto jump away and have you die. 
> 

Zed has massive counter play if you sport an iq over 80

> Tanks and enchanters bring real counterplay to the game. Not just this "Kill me faster or lose counterplay" Lulu used to be able to stop rengars from nuking targets just with R+shield. Good luck stopping him before he kills your adc in .25 seconds now.

Yeah dude, press w to shield someone for 50000hp then press q to knock them up and e to slow them

Also give 5k of gold to your allies


Oh then theres tanks


Press q to stun,  w to make you not die, e to slow, and r to totally outskill the enemy team by stunning them for like 45 minutes

These things are so much fun to play against and totally dont require specific items and champs to counter 


You can outplay an assassin in an assassin meta with any champ

You cant outplay a tank in a tank meta with any champ
